page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: GIRVAN has a wide choice of places of worship including two Churches of Scotland,one Roman Catholic,one Methodist,one Baptist,one Church of England,one Jehova's Witness,one Plymouth Brethren and one Christian Scientist. The vast majority of worshippers are Church of Scotland and Roman Catholic. Although there was considerable antagonism in the past there is little sign of any acrimony today. This is borne out by the fact that although the large Girvan Primary is next door to Sacred Heart,incidents are few and far between. Local clergy act as chaplains to the local schools,making visits to speak to the children.Terms often end with a Church service.
